subject: Development of Wayside Amenities along National Highways and Expressways De-scoping of Construction of Wayside Amenities from scope of road contractor and adherence to approved standard layout plan-reg.
text: Hrdlv 75v RTHRf giferas<ot (Tea5 @dev & RTHRf TATT4, MRa TETR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) 0444 * +fl-5 & 6, 4zz-10, ERo, #8f arft 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 T/Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Miscellaneous/ 2023 Policy Circular No.18.89/ 2023 dated O5th July, 2023 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/WSA/2023/2 (Comp. No. 206352)} Sub: Development of Wayside Amenities along National Highways and Expressways De-scoping of Construction of Wayside Amenities from scope of road contractor and adherence to approved standard layout plans reg: Ref: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Award of Wayside Amenities along National Highways and Expressways vide Circular No. 18.79 dated 11.03.2022 Kind attention is invited to Sr. No_ 10 of Policy Circular No. 18.79 dated 11.03.2022 , Standard Operating Procedure  (SOP) for Award of Wayside Amenities along National Highways and Expressways, it has been advised that the construction of Wayside Amenities may not be included in scope of road contractor (EPC/HAM/BOT) for Greenfield Expressways and Brownfield National Highway Projects. The construction of boundary wall, approach road, levelling / filling shall only be included in the scope. 2 Looking to the past experience of construction of WSA through road contractor viz- a-viz construction of WSA through private developer, following is decided: a No construction shall be included in the scope of EPC contractor across Greenfield Expressways and Brownfield National Highways for Wayside Amenities except construction of boundary wall, approach road and levelling/filling: b_ In case, construction of WSA is in scope of EPC contractor and development work is not started and at initial stage, the same shall be de-scoped and only items provided in the SOP dt: 11.03.2022 shall be constructed. Additionally, the details of land shall be forwarded to WSA Division for monetization: C The work of WSA shall be stopped immediately for sites where work is started. In these cases, the following committee is constituted to visit the site and assess the site condition in next 30 as per request of PD/ GM/ RO concerned: (i) Concerned Regional Officer (ii) Concerned Project Director (iii) Concerned ZO, NHLML Contd__2I - 9 7 & Ht NHAL days
